result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Grundman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim or victim's family. Not be on State Street in Madison, WI.

Def must be under the care of a psychiatrist. Def must cooperate fully in examination or evaluation recommended by the treating psychiatrist. Def must take all medication prescribed by the treating psychiatrist. Def must provide to the DOC a current authorization permitting the Dept to have complete access to all medical records of the def and permitting the treating psychiatrist to discuss openly and fully with the Dept respresentatives the Def's medical and psychiatric condition as well as his cooperation with treatment recommendations. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber.  Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply. Balance of sentence stayed when placed in stable housing deemed suitable by DOC. Credit does NOT apply.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: of Commitment for treatment.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; Ct called Dr Schoenecker(who appeared by phone), sworn by the Ct; direct exam by ADA Barnett; cross exam by Atty Welch; call disconnected; no more testimony; argument by counsel; Ct ruled that the defn is not competent and referred for an OCRP assessment.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; re: report of Dr. Schoenecker, counsel offer agreement with report, differ on the medication; Atty Welch offers that defn agrees with the Dr's report but objects to the order for involuntary medication; Ct questions having the Dr. available to testify; DDA Thompson offers input and request to set this over to Wed day or Thur PM for an Evidentiary hearing; Ct makes finding that the defn is not competent and continues this hearing till the Dr. Schoenecker is available to testify.
by Craig Schoenecker, M.D.
and returned
Competency hearing at 10-19-2015 02:30 pm
by DHS

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom;argument by ADA Barnett for cash bail; input by Atty Welch for a competency eval; Ct inquires of previous bail conditions; counsel respond; Ct orders bail modification; Ct orders competency exam; Ct adjourned.

CASH BOND SET - REFERRAL TO BMP
- Competency Exam Ordered by the Court
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail. 
-  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall continue working with counsellors at Journey Mental Health and Social Workers with DHS
- Defendant shall take prescribed meds
- Defendant shall provide an address verified by a qualified Social Worker assigned to his case. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with J.G.M.
- Defendant shall not be at Trinity Care Facility on Burke Rd in Madison, WI.
Trial Judge - Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
